core.title: Proportion of Rent to Income in Boston
core.shortDescription: Estimated proportion of rent to income as a percent of total occupied units, aggregated to the census tract level; geography covers the City of Boston; time period covers 2014-2018 as a five year average
core.fullDescription: This dataset represents the proportion of income spent on rent in Boston. The data originates from the United States Census Bureau's American Community Survey. The Census Bureau has aggregated individual survey responses to census tract geographies. The LMEC worked with cartographer Daniel Huffman to process the census data. We created a new dataset from the census data to study housing inequality in Boston. The geography covers the City of Boston. The time coverage compares changes between 2006-2010 and 2014-2018, each as five-year averages.
core.accessCondition: This dataset is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use.

temporal.temporalNotes: This dataset is derived as rolling estimates from the 2014-2018 5-year American Community Survey

ingredients.notes: This census tract geography data was joined to census statistical demographic data
This statistical census demographic data was joined to census tract geography data

processing.steps:
1. We downloaded statistics about rent and income from a census data download tool 
 2. We also downloaded census tract GIS boundary files from the same tool 
 3. We edited the data tables to only include important information about the topic of study 
 4. We renamed columns with human-readable column headers 
 5. We documented the new names in a codebook 
 6. We combined the new data tables to the GIS boundary files using GIS software to create the final dataset

publishedWorks.title: Proportion of units where rent costs over 30% of resident's income
